alert.note: Alert for Big Island South; Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 09 at 3:52PM HST until January 11 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU, KAUAI, OAHU, MOLOKAI, AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A large northwest swell has peaked and will drop below warning level by Monday morning. A new, larger swell will arrive Monday night and push surf above the warning level again for the north and west facing shores of Kauai to Maui. Surf for the west facing shores of the Big Island should remain at advisory levels. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST TUESDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Surf at 8 to 10 feet. * WHERE...West facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution.
